default: (a) a {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and a {@item shield|phb} or (b) two {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a) a {@item priest's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item scholar's pack|phb}
five {@item calligrapher's supplies|phb} and a {@item holy symbol|phb}

fluff.name: Scion
entries: The mammoth devil stands before the adventurers, he has attempted to claim the city for the Nine Hells but this group has managed to thwart his plan time and time again. In the front line stands a man wearing ragged clothes, an old shield, a rusty sword and a relaxed demeanor. As the devil charges violently, the ragged man makes a swift movement where he channels the power used to reshape reality to mark the devil with a blue sigil. When his sword cuts the devil, bolts of radiant energy coming from the sigil charge the rusty old sword.

Hidden from prying eyes, the high elf stares at her target from the rafters and places a small sigil on him. The moment he sits down, an unseen force pushes him towards the window violently. As the elf drops to the floor with elegance, a dark shadowy blade materializes on her hand. The man has heard the stories and knows that this is his end, those who dare speak ill of the church rarely live long enough to see the sun again.

Rumors speak that these men and women are born with the divine spark within giving them unrivaled power. Others speak of the divine agents as deadly myths to keep their children in check. Whatever the truth is, they are beings to be reckoned with.

Scions do not depend on an oath or hours of praying waiting for the gods to bless them, in fact they spend their time training martial techniques, as well as, studying religious texts and the planes hopping to one day tapping into the power wielded by the gods.

entries.name: An Order of Secrets
entries: Sometimes holy knights are of no help, there can be scenarios where there is a need to infiltrate the depths of a cult or even hide in plain sight in a town that has been possessed by dark powers. This is where scions come in, dark secretive agents that hunt that which is unholy putting their life in the line for those who judge them.

Scions have a reputation of being ruthless, murderous, blasphemous and even unworthy of the title of divine agents. Most do not care of the stories as this reputation helps them keep the innocent from interfering with their duty, sometimes they go as far as not let some church officials know the truth about them. This forces some priests to treat scions with fear and disdain because of the stories they hear, even if they are high ranking church officials.

In the end, scions wish to maintain this facade, to the point when they will feed stories for people to share hoping that they stay clear of their task. Some even cross the line of what is morally correct just to keep this illusion.

entries.name: Student of the Planes
entries: The gods ability to reshape reality leaves pockets of their essence for those with the time, patience and knowledge to use, with that small amount of divine power scions can manipulate the fabric of magic to cast spells.

Connecting to these pockets of power is easier said than done. First, the scion must enter a state that allows it to connect to the planes of existence and only then seek out remnant pockets of the power wielded by the gods. Afterwards, the scion must have on himself an object that can retain this power to use when needed. As time passes, scions learn to better reserve this energy and have it be more powerful, helping them cast stronger spells.
Before sleeping they perform a ritual to scavenge the realms for remnants of pure divine power, to do this they need to constantly read and understand the phlogiston, the planes and the cosmos.

entries.name: Source of Rumors
entries: What is the power wielded by a scion? That question is what keeps up many people at night. Many speak of them holding divine magic stolen from the gods, others speak of them as being born with the spark of divinity and some even say that their power comes from them connecting to the forces that keep the planes together. While it is not easy to describe their power, it is quite obvious that their rituals take a toll on them. This price can take many forms as mortals were not made to wield this power and yet they still strive to do it.

The power of a scion has price and while sometimes it can be mental exhaustion, other time it can be their body breaking down faster than any other person. It might not be known by all but it is quite clear that scions do not live to be old unless they manage to become one with their power, which many never manage to.

rows: You drank the blood of monsters and divine being to channel their abilities, turning you into a monster.
You perform dark rituals that connect you to fiendish creatures that help you perform heinous acts.
You were born this way, by a miracle amongst humanity to save them from utter destruction.
As a baby you were found in a cult's ritual chamber, where you found as the blood child of a divine being.
You are the scion of a deity, as such you were brought here to help or judge humanity.
There level of torture scions will do to get information is limitless and nothing will stand in their path.

entries.name: The Price of Power
entries: What is the power wielded by a scion? That question is what keeps up many people at night. Many speak of them holding divine magic stolen from the gods, others speak of them as being born with the spark of divinity and some even say that their power comes from them connecting to the forces that keep the planes together. While it is not easy to describe their power, it is quite obvious that their rituals take a toll on them. This price can take many forms as mortals were not made to wield this power and yet they still strive to do it.

The power of a scion has price and while sometimes it can be mental exhaustion, other time it can be their body breaking down faster than any other person. It might not be known by all but it is quite clear that scions do not live to be old unless they manage to become one with their power, which many never manage to.

rows: You have dreams of dark futures or items that will lead you on to greater purpose.
Your skin flakes at night causing you the need to every day remove the dead skin and give out bad odor.
Your body is full or weird markings that are neither arcane or divine.
You need to drink special potions every night or else you will become very ill.
While you might seem older than most, you are quite young and no one would believe your real age.
Your eyes, hair or even your blood is of an unusual color, such as purple.

entries.name: Eternal Students
entries: Scions are academics at heart and as such they enjoy learning new topics and will search for any information they can obtain, but there is always one subject they wish to master of independently of their magical studies. Such topics can vary from scion to scion and while some might be things they wish to hide from others, some can be topics they dabbled on to maintain a rumor and then became entrenched on it. Whatever the reason, books are enjoyed by scions to the point they might even go deep into a long lost ruins only to find a first edition of a book they wished to learn about.

Why did you get interested in this specific topic? Is it something that keeps your mind of the price of your power? Maybe this is what enticed you to become an adventurer separating yourself from the order. No matter what reasoning you put behind it, scions are always academics first and veteran fighters second.

rows: You enjoy the literature of romantic novels.
Philosophy is something that gets your mind going.
Planar theory is what you desire, how does our cosmos work?
Theology, yes you are a member of the church and as such you must uphold it's values.
Knowing a monsters anatomy and culture helps fight them.
Military strategy will always be needed in the battlefield.

entries.name: Creating a Scion
entries: When creating a scion, think about what deity or church is the one you serve and how you serve this order, this will help you choose a sacred task down the line.

Once this is done think about your characters motivations. What alignment do you use to fight the enemies of your church? What types of tasks are you sent to by your order? Do the rumors spoken by people affect you? How far are you willing to go to complete a task? What object do you use to gather the power of the gods? Is wielding this power a blasphemy?

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make an Scion quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Strength or Dexterity your highest ability score, depending on the type of weapons you want to use. Your next-highest score should be Intelligence. Second, choose the sage background.

classFeature.name: Sacred Knowledge
entries: At 1st level, you have learned the basics to manipulate the power wielded by the gods found across the planes into spells that all scions are trained to cast with some changes to the arcane formula. You know the {@spell mage armor} and {@spell comprehend languages} spells. These spells count as scion spells for you, but don't count against the number of scion spells you know. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

When you cast {@spell mage armor} on yourself, you can choose between using your Intelligence or Dexterity modifier to calculate the base AC. Moreover, when using {@spell comprehend languages} to read texts it takes you 30 seconds to read one page.
Once per long rest, you can cast each of these spells without using a spell slot. If you cast either of these spells this way, their duration is doubled.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 1st level, you adopt a particular style of fighting or channeling your magic as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

entries.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

entries.name: Planar Defense
entries: While you are under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Planar Fists
entries: By spending one hour per long rest, you can fuse a pair of hand wraps with your planar energy. While wearing them your unarmed strikes deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your Intelligence modifier. You use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack roll.
At 6th level, your unarmed strikes are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

entries.name: Planar Warrior
entries: Your time reading basic magic has helped you learn one cantrip of your choice from the {@filter scion spell list|spells|level=0|class=Scion (SCN)}. It counts as scion spell for you, Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it. Whenever your cantrips deal damage, you can add your Intelligence modifier to the roll.

entries.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

classFeature.name: Planar Power
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you have mastered the ritual that helps you gather the power of the gods scattered through out the planes, this plus your knowledge of arcane formulas allow you to cast spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 2nd level, the study of magical theory has helped you learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter scion spell list|spells|level=0|class=Scion (SCN)}. you learn additional scion cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Scion table.
When you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the scion cantrips you know with another cantrip from the scion spell list.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Scion table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your scion spells. The table also shows what the level of those slots is; all of your spell slots are the same level. To cast one of your scion spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.
For example, when you are 5th level, you have two 2nd-level spell slots. To cast the 1st-level spell {@spell cure wounds}, you must spend one of those slots, and you cast it as a 2nd-level spell.

entries.name: Memorized Spells of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You memorized two 1st-level spells of your choice from the scion spell list.

The Memorized Spells column of the scion table shows when you learn more scion spells of your choice of 1st level and higher. A spell you choose must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Slot Level column for your level. When you reach 10th level, for example, you learn a new scion spell, which can be 1st, 2nd, or 3rd level.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can't replace your spells, if you wish to do you must follow specific rules (See 'Memorized Spells' sidebar).

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your scion spells, so you use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a scion spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can spend one hour a day as part of your long rest to concentrate the power you harvested into a chosen {@item holy symbol|phb}, {@item shield|phb} or weapon. As a bonus action, you can summon your spell focus into your hand and can dismiss it into a pocket dimension  at anytime without using an action.
You can perform the somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a shield in one or both hands.

entries.name: Memorized Spells
entries: Unlike other spell casters, scions do not get their magic from and oath, prayer or even their bloodline, to cast spells scions must study arcane formulas to manipulate the fabric of magic like the gods do.

entries.name: Writing Down Spells
entries: Any Scion can have their memorized spells written down in any scroll by spending 1 hour and 50 gp. per level of the spell. In addition to this they must have {@item calligrapher's supplies|phb} and succeed an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) skill check against a DC 10 + the spell level.
Spells written by a scion can only be understood by other scions and used to learn spells not casting. Other spellcasters can't decipher the scrolls even if they use magic.

For each level of the spell, the process takes 2 hours and costs 50 gp. The cost represents material components you expend as you experiment with the spell to master it, as well as the fine inks you need to record it. Once you have spent this time and money, you can prepare the spell just like your other spells.

entries.name: Replacing Memorized Spells
entries: Scions can replace their memorized spells with another spell from the scion spell list, which also must be of a level for which they have spell slots. To do so they must spend 2 hour for each level of the spell they wish to learn, the previous spell is forgotten by them and cannot cast it in anyway possible.
The time spent represents the amount of time needed by a scion to learn the new spell in order to master it. In addition to this they must have any written way of studying the spell.

If you desire to learn a spell written by another spellcaster, it can only be done if you succeed an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) skill check against a DC 10 + the spells level. On a success, the scroll becomes unusable, turning it into dust. On a failure, the scion must spend one long rest before trying again.

classFeature.name: Sacred Sigil
entries: At 2nd level, the power you harvested from the planes can be used to mark your enemies with long forgotten divine sigils, small visible divine symbols that are placed on the creatures body. As a bonus action, you can place a seal on a creature you can see within 60 feet for 1 minute.  It ends early if the creature ends it's turn more than 60 feet away from you, it drops to 0 hit points or you are knocked unconscious.
While a creature has a sigil on it, it is considered a sealed creature. You can only have one seal active at a time.
The moment you choose to consume a seal, the creature is no longer under the effects of the sigil and therefore no longer sealed.
Whenever you hit the sealed creature with a melee weapon attack you choose to do one of the following:

items: Deal an extra {@dice 1d4} damage of your Planar Source type. The damage increases as you gain levels as a scion, as shown in the Sigil Damage column of the Scion table.
Consume the sigil to deal an extra number of d8's of damage equal to the maximum number of times you can use your seals per short rest, the type of this damage is that of your Planar Source.

entries: Once you have used your sigils the maximum number of times for your scion level, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use them again. You may use your sigils 2 times at 2nd level, 3 at 5th, 4 at 9th, 5 at 13th, and 6 at 17th.
When you reach 6th level, you can use a bonus action to remove the seal and place it a new creature.

entries.name: Planar Source
entries: Through your rigorous study of the planes and religious texts, you have learned how to tap into one of the sources of power wielded by the gods. Choose one of the following that best suits your alignment: Good, Neutral, Evil. This choice affects the damage type of your sigils based on the table below.

classFeature.name: Empower Sigil
entries: Your time studying the power wielded by the gods along along with arcane formulas has helped you learn how to empower your sigils making them deadlier.

When you reach 2nd level, you gain one sigil power of your choice from the {@filter list bellow|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=Sigil Power}. When you gain certain scion levels, you gain additional powers of your choice, as shown in the Sigil Powers column of the Scion table.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the powers you know and replace it with another one that you could learn at that level.
If a sigil power has a level prerequisite, it refers to your level in this class. You can learn the power at the same time that you meet its prerequisites.
You can use one sigil power at a time and each one once per long rest. If the power requires a saving throw to be made, the DC equals your scion spell save DC.

entries.name: Sigil of Conquest (6th Level or Higher)
entries: You can use your action to make a melee spell attack. On a hit, it takes an amount of damage equal to {@dice 2d8} plus your Intelligence modifier of the same type as your Planar Source. Additionally, the sealed creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is knocked {@condition prone} and it's speed is reduced to 0 until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Sigil of Harm
entries: Whenever you deal sigil damage to the creature, you can deal additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus. The damage dealt is of the type of your Planar Source.

entries.name: Sigil of Protection (6th Level or Higher)
entries: While the creature is sealed, you gain resistance against bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage made by the sealed creature.

entries.name: Sigil of Repulsion
entries: You can replace one of your attacks to force the sealed creature into making a Strength saving throw. On a failure, you can push it up to 15 feet.

entries.name: Sigil of Retribution
entries: As a reaction to the sealed creature attacking, you can force it to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it takes a number of d6's equal to the maximum number of times you can use your seals per short rest of the same damage type as your Planar Source.

entries.name: Sigil of Spellcraft
entries: The sealed creature gains a penalty to saving throws against spells you cast equal to the maximum number of times you can use your seals per short rest.

entries.name: Sigil of Stagnation (15th Level or Higher)
entries: When you place the seal on the creature or as an action, you can force the target into making a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is under the effects of the spell {@spell slow} while the creature is sealed or until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell).

classFeature.name: Divine Talent
entries: At 3rd level, the divine power flowing through you enhances your abilities. Choose one skill or tool proficiency from the scion list, including subclasses. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses the chosen proficiency.

classFeature.name: Sacred Task
entries: At 3rd level, you have graduated from a trainee into a high ranking official of a church. You choose how best you serve your church by selecting either Acolyte, Avenger, Inquisitor or Magus.
Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 15th level, and 20th.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Sacred Task Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Sacred Task.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Divine Weapon
entries: At 10th level, you mastered the manipulation of the planar power you wield. While you are holding your spell focus in your hand and you use your action to cast a spell, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Planar Arcanum (4th level)
entries: At 13th level, you can focus the planar power you have harvested and left to flow through your body into the most powerful spells that you can cast. Choose one {@filter 4th-level spell from the scion spell list|spells|level=4|class=Scion (SCN)} as this arcanum. You can cast your arcanum once without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

You can also expend an arcanum to cast a different scion spell you have memorized at a level corresponding to the level of the expended arcanum’s spell. For example, if you chose the 4th-level spell {@spell blight} as an arcanum, and you also know the {@spell armor of agathys} spell, you can expend this arcanum to cast magic missile as a 4th-level spell without expending a spell slot. Also, you can spend this arcanum to empower your sigils forcing them to be casted as if you were using a 4th level spell slot.
Finally, if you wish to replace your arcanum spell you must follow the rules detailed in the 'Memorized Spells' sidebar.

At 17th level, you gain a {@filter 5th-level spell scion spell|spells|level=5|class=Scion (SCN)} of your choice that can be cast this way. You regain all uses of your Planar Arcanum when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Sacred Task feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Sacred Task.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Planar Arcanum (5th level)
entries: At 17th level, you gain a {@filter 5th-level spell scion spell|spells|level=5|class=Scion (SCN)} of your choice that can be cast this way. You regain all uses of your Planar Arcanum when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Divine Succor
entries: When you reach 18th level, the control you have over the power of the gods flowing through your body has grown to where you can reach into the planes and bring forth a creature's spirit to assist you on your divine task. Once per long rest, as an action you cast a summoning spell at 6th level without using a spell slot and material components. The spell you are able to cast depends on your planar source and is based on the table below.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Sacred Task feature
entries: At 20th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Sacred Task.

subclassFeature.name: Acolyte
entries: Acolytes are the helping hand of the church, they are the ones you will find amongst the front lines of any sacred battlefield commanding the offense and providing protection as well as medical assistance. These scions have selflessly taken the task of assisting others achieve their goals.

subclassFeature.name: Acolyte Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this sacred task at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with the {@skill Medicine} skill and {@item herbalism kit|phb}

subclassFeature.name: Divine Light
entries: As an action, you can cast a ray of soothing light to remove one condition from a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. The condition has to be eitherStarting at 3rd level, you can spend your action to cast a ray of soothing light on a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. You can remove one condition from the target, the condition has to be either {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition poisoned}.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Acolyte Expanded Spell List
entries: Becoming an Acolyte lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a scion spell. The following spells are added to the scion spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Restorative Consumption
entries: At 7th level, when an ally hits a sealed creature with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to consume the seal and allow the attacker to regain a number of hit points equal to the damage dealt.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Church
entries: Starting at 14th level, each turn your allies hit a sealed creature, the target also takes {@dice 1d8} damage of the same type as your Planar Source.
Additionally, when a sealed creature targets one of your allies with an attack, that ally gains a +2 bonus to AC against that attack.

subclassFeature.name: Apotheosis
entries: Upon reaching 20th level, you have reached the point where you can connect to the essence of godly power turning yourself into a vessel of pure divine energy. Once per long rest as an action you can empower yourself for one minute, this transformation gives you the following abilities:

items: You can spend your action to touch a creature and remove all curses, ability score or hit point reductions.
You become immune to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions.
Allies in a 10 foot radius gain a bonus to saving throws equal to your Intelligence modifier.
You can use your reaction to reduce the amount of damage a creature would receive by {@dice 1d8} plus your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Avenger
entries: Avengers are the fearless agents of the church who pursue their quarry from the shadows using swords and bows, they are tasked on hunting down those who lurk in the dark and feed on the fears of people.

subclassFeature.name: Avenger Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this sacred task at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with the {@skill Survival} skill and {@item thieves' tools|phb}.

subclassFeature.name: Sacred Hunter
entries: Starting at 3rd level, even when you hit a creature sealed by you with ranged weapons you can use your sigil abilities.

subclassFeature.name: Avenger Expanded Spell List
entries: Becoming an Avenger lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a scion spell. The following spells are added to the scion spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Consumption
entries: When you reach 7th level, you can use your action once per long rest to consume your sigil. The previously sealed creature and every other creature in a 5 foot radius of it make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. All creatures take an amount of psychic damage equal to the consumption damage and are blinded until the end of your next turn on a failed save. On a successful one, the creature only takes half as much damage.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Predator
entries: At 14th level, you can use your bonus action to see in normal and magical darkness, as well as, {@condition invisible} creatures and objects up to a range of 30 feet. Additionally, while active you gain immunity to the {@condition frightened} condition. This feature lasts a number of rounds equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Call Upon the Aether
entries: Starting at 20th level, you can summon the mists of the Ethereal Plane into the Material Plane to protect you. Once per long rest and as an action, you can call this mist for one minute, giving you the following abilities:

items: While you are in bright light you have half cover and in dim light or darkness you have three-quarters cover.
Creatures cannot gain any benefit from being invisible or hidden as long as they are within 10 feet of you.
You can see, affect and be affected by creatures that are from the Ethereal Plane.

Once per turn, you can use your action to force a creature within 10 feet of you into making a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes {@dice 1d8} plus your Intelligence modifier necrotic damage and it is {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn. You can only affect 1 creature at a time and can't stack it on the same creature.

subclassFeature.name: Inquisitor
entries: Inquisitors are the might and strength of each order, they are soldiers trained to protect that which is most holy and hunt down those who oppose them. As such, they are seen as powerful warriors who are stoic and inflexible in their duty.

subclassFeature.name: Inquisitor Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this sacred task at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with the {@skill Intimidation} skill and {@item smith tools|phb}

subclassFeature.name: Divine Fury
entries: Starting at 3rd level, as part of your {@action attack} action you can make one additional weapon attack.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Inquisitor Expanded Spell List
entries: Becoming an Inquisitor lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a scion spell. The following spells are added to the scion spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Warding Consumption
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you can reclaim some of the power of your sigils to protect you. As a bonus action you can consume a seal and create a ward around you. You gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your scion level plus your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Knight
entries: When you reach 14th level, you allow the power of the planes to fuel your attacks. When you place a sigil on a creature, you can spend a spell slot to gain advantage on all melee weapon attacks against the creature. This feature lasts while a creature is sealed or until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell).

subclassFeature.name: Awakened Form
entries: Starting at 20th level, once per long rest, you can spend you action to awaken your divinity allowing you to transform into a creature from another plane of existence for one minute, gaining the following abilities:

items: Your size grows by one size category and your weapons also grow to match its new size. While these weapons are enlarged, your attacks with them deal {@damage 1d4} extra damage.
Resistance against bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing attacks.
Your Dexterity score increases by 10, as does your Dexterity maximum.

subclassFeature.name: Magus
entries: Scions who become Magus forgo some martial prowess to improve their magical talents. While still limited by the amount of power they can harvest from the planes, they have perfected the way they can channel their power.

subclassFeature.name: Magus Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this sacred task at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@skill Investigation} skill and {@item alchemist's supplies|phb}.

subclassFeature.name: Sacred Arcana
entries: At 3rd level, whenever you finish a long rest you can replace one cantrip you know with another cantrip from the {@filter scion|spells|level=0|class=Scion (SCN)} or {@filter wizard|spells|level=0|class=Wizard} spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Magus Expanded Spell List
entries: Becoming an Magus lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a scion spell. The following spells are added to the scion spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Consumption
entries: Starting at 7th level,   as a bonus action you may consume a seal to regain a spell slot from your Planar Power feature. Once you use this feature, you can't do so until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Arcanist
entries: Beginning at 14th level, you choose one spell from the scion spell list of up to 2nd level. Once per long rest, you can cast the spell at its lowest level without expending a spell slot, this is as long as you have it memorized.

subclassFeature.name: Transcendence
entries: At 20th level you have learned how the raw source of magic intertwines with the forces of creation, this understanding allows you to, once per long rest as an action, enter a state of enlightenment for one minute.

items: You can cast Counterspell at it's lowest level without spending a spell slot.
You can add your Intelligence modifier to all Saving Throw rolls against spells that target you.
When you cast a spell that deals a type of damage from the following list, you can change the damage type to one of the other listed types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, thunder.

spell.name: Aura of Self-doubt
entries: Your words radiate insecurity on those that would oppose you. Each hostile creature in the aura must succeed a Charisma saving throw at the start of their turn or suffer a penalty to their attack rolls equal to your spell casting ability modifier.

spell.name: Fire Whip
entries: You produce a whip of fire that you can use as a weapon. This whip lasts for the duration of the spell. It counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. It deals 1d10 fire damage on a hit and has the finesse, reach of 10 feet and light properties. In addition, when you hit a creature with an attack from this whip the creature must succeed a Strength saving throw or be restrained. While the creature is restrained, at the start of it's turn you deal 1d10 fire damage to the target, it can use it's action to attempt to break free by rolling a Strength saving throw. If the creature succeeds, it breaks free and it is no longer restrained, in case of a failure it can repeat the saving throw on it's next turn. You cannot attack any creature with this weapon if you have a creature restrained.

spell.name: Mist of Sacrilege
entries: A red mist full of negative energy surrounds you with a 15-foot radius. Until the spell ends, the mist moves with you, centered on you. If a creature (except you) starts their turn in the mist, they take 3d8 necrotic damage and you gain hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

spell.name: Sigil of Judgement
entries: You place a sigil on a creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, whenever the creature wishes to speak a lie it must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is dealt {@damage 1d6} force damage.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can thus avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such creatures can be evasive in its answers as long as it has the sigil on it.

Additionally, you can spend your bonus action to force the creature to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is dealt {@damage 1d6} plus your spellcasting ability modifier force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Mist of Damnation
entries: You concentrate divine energy on yourself creating an area of pure negative energy on the mundane world. You conjure a 15-foot radius of mist, darkness, brimstone, and blasting heat, that resonates with echoes of damned souls, the area is centered on you and lasts in place for the duration of the spell.

Any creature, other than you, that ends their turn in the mist take {@damage 2d8} fire damage and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take an additional {@damage 2d8} psychic damage as well as gaining disadvantage on its attack rolls and ability checks until the end of their next turn as the voices of the damned cloud their mind.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the fire damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Vexing Blade

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and then becomes surrounded in negative energy until the start of your next turn. If the target does not use its action to only attack you, it takes necrotic damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage to the target on a hit, and the necrotic damage the target takes for not attacking you increases to {@damage 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Both damage rolls increase by 1d8 at 11th level ({@damage 2d8} and {@damage 2d8}) and 17th level ({@damage 3d8} and {@damage 3d8}).

scalingLevelDice.label: necrotic damage on not attacking you

optionalfeature.name: Planar Defense
entries: While you are under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

optionalfeature.name: Planar Fists
entries: By spending one hour per long rest, you can fuse a pair of hand wraps with your planar energy. While wearing them your unarmed strikes deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} plus your Intelligence modifier. You use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack roll.
At 6th level, your unarmed strikes are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

optionalfeature.name: Planar Warrior
entries: Your time reading basic magic has helped you learn one cantrip of your choice from the {@filter scion spell list|spells|level=0|class=Scion (SCN}. It counts as scion spell for you, Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it. Whenever your cantrips deal damage, you can add your Intelligence modifier to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Sigil of Conquest
entries: You can use your action to make a melee spell attack. On a hit, it takes an amount of damage equal to {@damage 2d8} plus your Intelligence modifier of the same type as your Planar Source. Additionally, the sealed creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is knocked {@condition prone} and it's speed is reduced to 0 until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Sigil of Harm
entries: Whenever you deal sigil damage to the creature, you can deal additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus. The damage dealt is of the type of your Planar Source.

optionalfeature.name: Sigil of Protection
entries: While the creature is sealed, you gain resistance against bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage made by the sealed creature.

optionalfeature.name: Sigil of Repulsion
entries: You can replace one of your attacks to force the sealed creature into making a Strength saving throw. On a failure, you can push it up to 15 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Sigil of Retribution
entries: As a reaction to the sealed creature attacking, you can force it to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it takes a number of d6's equal to the maximum number of times you can use your seals per short rest of the same damage type as your Planar Source.

optionalfeature.name: Sigil of Spellcraft
entries: The sealed creature gains a penalty to saving throws against spells you cast equal to the maximum number of times you can use your seals per short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sigil of Stagnation
entries: When you place the seal on the creature or as an action, you can force the target into making a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is under the effects of the spell {@spell slow} while the creature is sealed or until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell).
